intro: Tetrapleura chevalieri, commonly known as African satinwood, is a tropical tree native to western and central Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its smooth, pale bark and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, followed by elliptical, woody fruits. Its wood is valued for its fine grain and is used in furniture and cabinet making. The plant also has traditional medicinal uses in some African communities.
